item.description:
Join us for our usual casual brunch affair, where the conversation ranges widely in a superstition-free atmosphere. Whet your appetite with a peek at the menu: http://www.orleansrestaurant.com/. As we often do with our brunches, we've selected a charity to support with voluntary giving.

 

This time, we're supporting a fundraising effort undertaken by the brother of one Olivia van N., of our members. His organization, http://www.upenyu.org..., provides treatment for children afflicted with parasitic diseases. If their project at http://www.globalgivi... raises $5,000 from 40 donors by February 29, 11:59 PM, they'll earn a permanent spot on the website GlobalGiving, making their future development work a lot easier.

SINCE the fundraising deadline is BEFORE the brunch date, please note in the comments section below whether you plan to donate -- I'll send a check in on the group's behalf, and recoup anything I pay out of pocket when I see you. With no additional charge for the service, ahem.

Even if you don't plan to attend the brunch, you're welcome to chip in to the donation via PayPal (or other arrangements... contact me to make a cash or check contribution). 85% of donations to this cause go directly to Upenyu; the remaining 15% is retained by GlobalGiving to maintain their infrastructure.

Olivia writes: "I thought I would try to reach out to any of you who want to help my brother's secular effort in a region of Zimbabwe that is dominated by religious influences. His team treats schistosomiasis, which mainly affects little kids-- they urinate blood and fail at school because of these horrible parasites that are actually incredibly easy to treat."

If you are aware of a local cause that you'd like to see supported by an upcoming Blasphemy Brunch, let us know!
item.name: March Blasphemy Brunch
